p: Romanian scientists have reported that the main component of the essential oil of A. abrotanum herb was davanone and its derivatives. The researchers also isolated, in small amounts, 1-terpineol, trans-piperitol, and estragole [ 47]. In contrast, the dominant compound in the essential oil of plants harvested in Cuba was trans-sabinyl acetate [ 44], and in the essential oil from plants harvested in Iraq borneol [ 48]. The main components in plants harvested in Crimea were 1,8-cineole and camphor [ 49]. The chemical structures of the most abundant compounds in A. abrotanum essential oil are shown in Figure 1.
